intro: Crataegus excelsa, commonly known as the tall hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters, featuring thorny branches and dense, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces white or pinkish flowers in spring, followed by red or orange berries in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands, hedgerows, and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
